message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: String values = "firstname=john&lastname=fob&email=something@something.com&Telephone=3874813781";
StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(values, "&");
while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
    String token = st.nextToken();
    String[] parts = token.split("=");
    String parameter = parts[0];
    String value = parts[1];
    System.out.println(parameter + ": " + value);
}
<<<explanation>>>: In this code, we first create a StringTokenizer object with the input string and the delimiter "&". Then, we iterate through the tokens using the hasMoreTokens() method. For each token, we split it into two parts using the "=" delimiter. The first part is the parameter name and the second part is the value. We then print out the parameter and its corresponding value.
